system
Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
  system.GameEngine

public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object

The class GameEngine represents the central hub of the Bomberman game. It is where all the other classes are compiled together to execute the game. It contains ten methods and they initialize the game and its functions including single player, multiplayer, loading, saving, level up and gameOver.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Brett Leighton, Leotard Niyonkuru, Marc-Andre Cataford, Mete Kemertas, Martin Zhang

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
This is the main method of the GameEngine class. It intializes a new GameStatus, GameGraphics, and GamePhysics. It also creates a thread for both the physics and graphics class. It also generates a new graphical panel which contains the main menu.

Parameters:
args -

quitGame

public static void quitGame()
This method represents the options presented to the user when he wants to quit the game. It asks the user whether he wants to save or not prior to quitting.

pauseGame

public static void pauseGame()
This method pauses the game.

resumeGame

public static void resumeGame()
This method resumes the game from a pause.

saveGame

public static void saveGame(GameStatus gs)
This method creates a new file representing the current game status. It then gets the current x and y co-ordinates, score, lives, and powerups collected and saves them in the file created. It also creates a catch exception, in case the information is not found.

Parameters:
gs - This takes as input the current game status

loadScores

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> loadScores()
This method reads from the saved high scores text file and adds them to an ArrayList which is suppose to contain all the scores saved.

Returns:
loadedscores returns the ArrayList containing all the scores read.

saveScores

public static void saveScores()
This method creates a new file call highscores.bombSave. It then reads the scores from GameStatus and writes the scores into the text file.

loadGame

public static void loadGame()
This method loads the save file created in saveGame. It loads the file into a buffered reader and reads the integers stored in the file, representing the various attributes of the player at save.It then takes that information and writes them into the GameStatus.

commitScore

public static void commitScore(Player player)
This method takes as input a player and takes the score of the player from the GameStatus. It then converts the score to a string and adds it into memeory in GameStatus.

Parameters:
player - the player whos score is being comited.

startGame

public static void startGame()
This method calls one of two possible methdos in GameEngine depending on if the game is one player or two player.

startOnePlayerGame

public static void startOnePlayerGame()
This method starts a one player game by adding a new player at the starting location and starting the physics and graphics thread.

startTwoPlayerGame

public static void startTwoPlayerGame()
This method starts a two player game by adding two players at the starting location and setting one of them to inActive.

startThreads

public static void startThreads()
This method starts the physics and graphics thread

levelUp

public static void levelUp()
This method controls what happens when a player reaches the next level by repopulating the map and reseting the players co-ordinates.

gameOver

public static void gameOver()
This method controls what happens when the game is over by printing a Game Over line and then exiting.

addBindings

public static void addBindings(GraphicalPanel gamePanel)
This method maps the up, down, left, right and space keys to their corresponding actions in the action package. It does this by adding it to an input map and then corresponding that to an action map. The action and input maps are taken from the input gamePanel.

Parameters:
gamePanel - This is the gamepanel from which the action and input maps are taken.

setMenuBars

public static void setMenuBars(javax.swing.JFrame mainFrame)
This method sets up the menu bars of the bomberman game. It takes as input a JFrame which is used to create the menu. It generates the buttons of the main menu from the Panels package and allows the player to navigate using arrow keys.

Parameters:
mainFrame - The JFrame to be used to create the main menu.

generatePanel

public static GraphicalPanel generatePanel(GraphicalPanel gp)
This method takes as input a GraphicalPanel and contains a constructor for a new BackgroundPanel. It sets the input panel in the center of the new BackgroundPanel and returns the panel.

Parameters:
gp - This is the graphic panel to be centred.
Returns:
backgroundPanel Returns the input panel centred.

generateInstPanel

public static GraphicalPanel generateInstPanel(GraphicalPanel gp)
This method takes as input a GraphicalPanel and contains a constructor for a new instructions panel. .

Parameters:
gp - This is the graphic panel on which the instructions panel is painted
Returns:
instructionsBg this is the instructions panel created

This method takes as input a GraphicalPanel and adds it to the frame.

Parameters:

panel - the panel to be added onto the javaFrame
